_header: He maketh himself great in richesse
Note:
See Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, no. 7859.
_description: A couplet translating ‘Hic bene se ditat qui semper inania uitat’

NLS18721.Transcription:
He makt himself in gret richesseÞat nith an day flet
                    wrechednesse
NLS18721.Note:
Preceded by Hic bene se ditat qui semper inancia
                    vitat.
